data.title: Bucknell University
data.text:
2023 (Senior): During his senior season with the Bison, he made valuable contributions with four goals, one block, and two steals.

2022 (Junior): Appeared in 17 contests for Bucknell...scored three goals and added five assists...scored goals against Mount San Antonio (9/4), McKendree (9/24) and Salem...posted three assists in win over Merychurst (9/25).

2021 Fall (Sophomore): Appeared in 19 games for the Bison...scored four goals and added one assist on the season...had two goals in season debut against Cal (9/4).

2021 (First-Year): Appeared in two games...scored first career goal at No. 9 Navy (2/20)...named MAWPC Rookie of the Week after posting two assists in NCAA Quarterfinal at No. 4 USC (3/18).

Before Bucknell: Earned full colors at Jeppe High School in Water Polo, Half Colors in Swimming, and Provincial Colors in rugby…team captain in water polo, playing four years for the First Team…also captain of Provincial Team, and played for provincial squad for six years…Named MVP of South Africa Junior Nationals in 2019, and was also named the defender of the tournament at the South Africa Schools Tournament in 2019…High School Team was ranked in the top 10 in the nation, and won the Gauteng Top Eight Tournament in 2018…member of Two National Championship Provincial Teams, and also was a part of South Africa National Team that won the 2018 EU Nations Cup in Prague, Czech Republic.

Personal: Liam Thomas Stott…Born on 3/13/2001 in Johannesburg, South Africa…son of Robert and Cindy…member of 4x50 relay team in swimming that set school record in both the freestyle and medley events…has one sibling, Caitlin…Member of First Team Rugby for two years, and also played rugby for Golden Lions Rugby Union…was named head boy (class president) of graduating class…also participated in school plays, and was named best actor.
